Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Droop cup; interior: glazed black with reserved band above join of lip and bowl; exterior: lip glazed; in handle zone, thin black band above black-figure chariot scene; two frontal horses preserved, of that to left upper body with mane and bridle in added red, of that to right only part of mane in red; at break to right part of head of occupant of car; painted nonsense inscription in field.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Ure places the cup within his Droop Cups group C or E.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 427, no. B678)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 42, no. 31, pl. XXI, no. 31)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 271, no. 6 quater)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1413) (phase 3)
